definitions.definition: Conforming to the actual state of reality or fact ; factually correct .

subdefinitions.definition: As an ellipsis of "(while) it is true (that)", used to start a sentence
examples: True , I have only read part of the book, but I like it so far.

definitions.definition: Conforming to a rule or pattern; exact; accurate.
examples: a true likeness of the original

definitions.definition: Of the state in Boolean logic that indicates an affirmative or positive result.
examples: "A and B" is true if and only if "A" is true and "B" is true .
He’s turned out to be a true friend.
This is true Parmesan cheese — it is from the Parma region.

subdefinitions.definition: Used in the designation of group of species, or sometimes a single species, to indicate that it belongs to the clade its common name (which may be more broadly scoped in common speech) is restricted to in technical speech, or to distinguish it from a similar species, the latter of which may be called false .
examples: true blusher ( Amanita rubescens , as distinguished from the false blusher , Amanita pantherina )
The true bugs are those of the order Hemiptera; and, by some lights, most truly those of the suborder Heteroptera.

definitions.definition: Accurate ; following a path toward the target .
labels: of an aim or missile in archery
definitions.label_groups: of an aim or missile in archery , shooting , golf , etc.

definitions.definition: Correctly aligned or calibrated , without deviation .
examples: Is my bike wheel true ? It feels unsteady.

main_definition: ( of a statement ) Conforming to the actual state of reality or fact ; factually correct .
secondary_definitions: Conforming to a rule or pattern; exact; accurate.
( logic ) Of the state in Boolean logic that indicates an affirmative or positive result.
( of an aim or missile in archery , shooting , golf , etc. ) Accurate ; following a path toward the target .
( of a mechanical part ) Correctly aligned or calibrated , without deviation .
( chiefly probability ) Fair , unbiased , not loaded .
( of a literary genre ) based on actual historical events .
